result.execSummary:
The defendant James Willie Brown Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: If employed at time of revocation, defendant can have release for work.  If unemployed when revoked can participate in HOC work programs.

miscConds.notes:
Court waived DNA surcharge because the Court finds the defendant is not likely to reoffend.
Pay all other costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Successfully complete an anger management  or a Batterers Intervention program.
Follow any Family Court orders that arise out of pending case.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Willie Brown Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered. Case adjourned for sentencing to Branch 25.

Defendant James Willie Brown in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State filed and Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to sec. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.

Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty at this time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Willie Brown in court with attorney Stephen Sargent on behalf of Louis E Epps.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. State has provided an offer and defense counsel has provided a counter-offer. Parties inform the court this matter may resolve by the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Willie Brown in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Erin Karshen for Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CVB (1/11/1958).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Willie Brown in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant James Willie Brown in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge ROTHSTEIN, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
